USD Index Signal

USD Index signal: tracking the strength of the US Dollar against major currencies.

As of 2025-11-29

Gemini Summary

The state of the market suggests a weakening U.S. Dollar, generally creating a bullish environment for inversely correlated assets like precious metals and industrial metals. The Broad U.S. Dollar Index (DTWEXBGS) stands at 122.2350 (as of 2025-11-01), remaining below its 12-month moving average of 123.810333. This positioning, despite a marginal 6-month change of +0.101383%, triggers a 'Bullish' signal for dollar-sensitive assets. This implies an easing of financial conditions, which could also support global equities, while bonds may face nuanced reactions depending on inflation expectations. Overall sentiment leans towards a supportive backdrop for commodity-linked investments.

Technical Summary: Technically, the DTWEXBGS at 122.2350 is below its 12-month MA of 123.810333, indicating a downtrend for the dollar. This technical setup signals a 'Weakening' USD, translating to a 'Bullish' outlook for assets that typically strengthen when the dollar declines. This suggests that the current momentum favors an environment conducive to rising commodity prices and potentially improved performance for international equities, as a weaker dollar enhances their relative value.

References:

  • Trade-Weighted U.S. Dollar Index: Broad (DTWEXBGS, FRED): Data as of 2025-11-01. This is the core dataset for dollar strength assessment and highly relevant.
  • USD Index Signal Methodology White Paper, Version 1.0: Provides the analytical framework for signal generation and interpretation.
Publicly available data that would enhance future analysis includes interest rate differentials (e.g., US vs. EU 10-year yields) to gauge monetary policy divergence, global inflation expectations to anticipate real returns, and key economic growth indicators (e.g., global PMI data) to understand relative economic performance and capital flows.
